intro: Baumgartia scandens, commonly known as the climbing beautyberry, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States, characterized by its trailing growth habit and ability to climb or trail along structures. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a distinctive, showy, bluish-purple berry that ripens in the fall. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens.
